content.title: Leprosy Pension Scheme
content.department: Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities, Uttar Pradesh
content.beneficiary: Persons with disabilities due to leprosy
content.details: Leprosy Pension Scheme has been started by the Government of Uttar Pradesh and operated by the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities, Uttar Pradesh. The main objective of the scheme is to provide a grant-in-aid for the maintenance of persons with disabilities and leprosy, whose family income is not sufficient for them.
benefits: Grant of Rs. 3000/- per month for beneficiaries disabled due to Leprosy
eligibility: Disabled due to leprosy (with any percentage of disability)
Persons with disabilities due to leprosy may belong to any age group
Must be below the poverty line: Rs. 56,460/- per annum for urban and Rs. 46,080/- per annum for rural areas
Not a beneficiary of other pension schemes

faqs.question: What is Leprosy Pension Scheme?
faqs.answer: This Leprosy Pension Scheme has been started by the Government of Uttar Pradesh and operated by the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities, Uttar Pradesh.

faqs.question: What are the benefits under the scheme?
Who can get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: All the eligible people who are suffering from leprosy and are residents of Uttar Pradesh.

faqs.question: Is there any eligibility percentage of disability with LEPROSY?
faqs.answer: No, disabled due to leprosy (with any percentage of disability).

faqs.question: From which age group can a person apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: There is no age restriction to get the scheme benefit.

faqs.question: What is the maximum annual income criteria for urban residents?
faqs.answer: Urban residents should be under Rs. 56,460/- per annum.

faqs.question: What is the maximum annual income criteria for rural residents?
faqs.answer: Rural residents should be under Rs. 46,080/- per annum.

faqs.question: Can beneficiaries of other pension schemes get the benefit of this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, applicants should not be beneficiaries of other pension schemes.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: 1. First of all the applicant has to visit the official Portal. 2. Fill out the online application form from here. 3. In the Application form, the applicant has to fill following details: Personal Details, Bank Details, Income Details, and a description of a disability. 4. Upload the required documents (Photograph, Age Certificate and Disability Certificate).
